intro: Acianthera fornograndensis, commonly known as the Brazilian violet, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its small, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in forest understories. It has thin, grass-like leaves and produces delicate, fragrant blooms. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
